Package NumberConverterSystem.Models

Class QuizQuestion

java.lang.Object
NumberConverterSystem.Models.QuizQuestion
public class QuizQuestion extends Object
The QuizQuestion class represents a single question in a number base conversion quiz within the Number Converter System. It encapsulates all relevant data for a quiz question, including the value to be converted, source and target bases, the correct answer, the user's answer, and whether the user's answer was correct.

This class is designed to facilitate interactive quizzes, allowing for the generation, display, and verification of user responses to conversion questions. Each instance stores both the question parameters and the user's response, supporting detailed feedback and score tracking.

Features:

  • Stores the value to be converted, source base, and target base for the quiz question.
  • Records the correct answer for the conversion, as well as the user's submitted answer.
  • Tracks whether the user's answer matches the correct answer.
  • Provides a method to verify the user's answer and update correctness status.

Usage Example: 

 // Create a new quiz question
 QuizQuestion q = new QuizQuestion("101", "5", 2, 10);

 // User submits an answer
 q.verifyAnswer("5");

 // Check if the answer was correct
 if (q.isCorrect) {
     System.out.println("Correct!");
 } else {
     System.out.println("Incorrect. The correct answer is " + q.correctAnswer);
 }

2025-08-26

  • Field Details

    • value

      public String value
      The value to be converted in the quiz question.

      This is the raw input presented to the user, in the format appropriate for the sourceBase.

      Example: "101" (binary), "A3" (hexadecimal)

    • sourceBase

      public int sourceBase
      The base in which the value is represented.

      This integer specifies the source base for the conversion (e.g., 2 for binary, 10 for decimal).

    • targetBase

      public int targetBase
      The base to which the value should be converted.

      This integer specifies the target base for the conversion (e.g., 10 for decimal, 16 for hexadecimal).

    • correctAnswer

      public String correctAnswer
      The correct answer for the conversion.

      This is the expected result of converting value from sourceBase to targetBase.

      Example: "5" (decimal), "101" (binary)

    • userAnswer

      public String userAnswer
      The answer submitted by the user.

      This field is set when the user responds to the quiz question. It is compared to correctAnswer to determine correctness.

    • isCorrect

      public boolean isCorrect
      Indicates whether the user's answer matches the correct answer.

      This boolean is updated when verifyAnswer(String) is called.

      True: User's answer is correct.
      False: User's answer is incorrect.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuizQuestion

      public QuizQuestion(String value, String correctAnswer, int sourceBase, int targetBase)
      Constructs a new QuizQuestion object with the specified value, correct answer, source base, and target base.

      Initializes the question parameters and sets userAnswer to null and isCorrect to false.

      Parameters:
      value - The value to be converted in the quiz question.
      correctAnswer - The correct answer for the conversion.
      sourceBase - The base in which the value is represented.
      targetBase - The base to which the value should be converted.

  • Method Details

    • verifyAnswer

      public void verifyAnswer(String userAnswer)
      Verifies the user's answer against the correct answer.

      Sets the userAnswer field to the provided value and updates isCorrect to true if the user's answer matches correctAnswer, or false otherwise.

      Parameters:
      userAnswer - The answer submitted by the user.
